Faculty don't always have input on decision making

review_title: Don't judge a book by its cover
job_title: Financial Aid Assistant in Cicero, IL
pros: Helping students and parents in a community where it is much needed.
cons: The current administration does not care about the community as a whole as much as they portray. They are more focused on getting paid big bucks and politics.

pros: The pay and benefits were good
Flexible schedule, great pay,  some awesome  colleagues!
cons: Dirty, lying management, board and administration.  Extremely punitive; avoids responsibility for abusing employees; human resources will not help you if the management is falsifying information.  ***  If you didn't  date the former union president - who was a predator of younger women(new divorcees) who had kids, including two women that worked in the theater who were half his age; and a former faculty member.   Combined with a clear past of this behavior including dating his second wife (who was his student) while married to his first wife.   Also, an administration and board that frequently made things up; filed false investigations and harassed faculty.  As an aside the EX union President, didn't assert his rights by bringing union officers in on the day the school asked him to leave.  He claimed there is a gag order in affect.  He doesn't want you to know that after 35 years he too got caught with his hand in the cookie jar.   Why on earth with he agree to leave and remain mum?  Because he was an abuser, and because the school finally found a way to get him out.  He was a thug.  They too were thugs.  I should write a book about all that I know.  I call bull poop on the "gag order:

pros: New food service is run by Paisan's so the food in the cafeteria is a lot better now.
cons: Politics abound. Administration does nothing but hamper the work, and they get paid lots for doing not much. Students are never told that they are not cut out for higher learning - no matter how many times they fail, Morton keeps taking their loan money, and eventually some teacher passes them. There is a union but it is so weak it's laughable, as most unions are these days. The buildings are old, most classrooms lack technological capabilities, counseling services are a joke, and the whole place runs on the backs of seriously underpaid adjunct faculty who think they might get a full time position someday but will actually be fired after 5-7 years. The quality of the education to be had here is spotty at best, with the exception of the nursing program, which is quite good. In these days of lean pickings, if you can get workhere, take it...but plan on leaving soon if you want happiness and advancement at work. Even the wi if sucks here, it's slow and cuts out all the time.

review_title: Morton College only retains Hispanic workers
pros: The best reasons was working with students. Most are there to learn.
cons: As an adjunct faculty, if youre there for more than 5 years you get bumped for no reason.

review_title: Teetering on the edge, about to nosedive.
pros: Great student population. Good hours, easy to keep work-life balance. Most faculty and staff are dedicated to delivering a great educational experience to students despite the many many obstacles in their way from higher ups.
cons: Soon to have massive staff cuts due to the state budget. Seemingly ignoring HLC advice on how to stay in good standing. The inner circle gets raises without conducting performance reviews while 1/3 of the staff get laid off. Board members move into positions and no one bats an eye. Despite strong academic and support services the College seems to be rotting from the top down.

review_title: The college is due to lose its accreditation in 13 months.  The higher learning commission may shut them down feb 2020
cons: Greasy slime balls that pocket line
